result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard L Keller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Any sentence currently serving

superMiscConds.notes: All counts: Fines, costs, and restitution are due during term of supervision.  Court further orders 25% of prison wages to be applied toward Court-ordered financial obligations.  If defendant is released with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

Register as a Sex Offender.
No contact with children.
No computer or Internet access.
To be monitored on GPS.
Submit to DNA sample.

records.descr: Remittitur/Court of Appeals dec & order affirming

records.addlTxt: Petition for Review is Denied.

It is ordered that the motion is denied.  The 30-day period in which to file a petition for review may not be enlarged.  It is further ordered the motion itself shall be deemed to be a timely but nonconforming petition for review.  However, a statement in support of the petition, conforming to the requirements of Wis. State 809.62(2) and (4), must be filed with the clerk of this court by September 21, 2018.  If the statement is not filed by that time, this petition will be summarily dismissed.
It is ordered that the judgment of conviction is summarily affirmed.  It is further ordered that Attorney Basil M. Loeb is relieved from further representing Richard L. Keller in this appeal.

Defendant Richard L Keller in court with attorney Matt Last.  Defendant in custody. Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Recommendation given by State. Statement by defense. Court renders sentence.

1/27/2016 Trial    
Exhibits located in Exhibit Room SH 3-3
PRELIMINARY Jury Instructions
Court's Voir Dire
Verdicts (10)
Sentencing hearing at 04-06-2016 03:00 pm

Defendant Richard L Keller in court with attorney Matt Last.  Defendant in custody. Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests sequestration of witnesses after jury has been selected. Court grants request. 
8:58am Jury panel sworn; 20 jurors called to the jury box.
9:02am Voir Dire by the Court
9:17am Voir Dire by the State
9:37am Voir Dire by the Defense
9:50am Striking of the jury
9:58am Jury panel of 12 selected; remaining jurors thanked and excused. Preliminary instructions read by the Court
10:10am Recess
10:28am In session, same appearances
10:33am Opening by State
10:45am Opening by Defense
10:51am H.S. sworn and testifies
11:05am J. L. sworn and testifies
11:18am Detective G. Speth sworn and testifies
11:51am Jury excused for lunch recess. Jury instruction conference held off the record 
12:15pm Lunch recess until 1:15pm
1:14pm Case recalled, same appearances
1:18pm M.O. sworn and testifies
1:34pm Exhibits 4-13 published to the jury
1:37pm The State rests.
1:39pm Jury excused; Defense moves to dismiss. State opposes motion. Court denies motion. Defense advises defendant as to decision not to testify. 
1:55pm Final jury instruction conference held off the record
2:26pm In session, same appearances. Jury brought in
2:30pm Jury instructions by the Court
2:41pm Closing argument by State
2:54pm Closing argument by Defense
3:13pm Rebuttal by State
3:24pm Remaining instructions given by the Court. Bailiff sworn
3:32pm Jury out for deliberation. Court stands in recess
4:46pm Case recalled, same appearances. Jury called into court with Guilty verdicts on all 10 counts
4:54pm Jury polled, thanked and discharged by the Court. Court grants judgment on the verdict. Court orders Exhibit #3 with contents of Exhibits #4 thru #13 sealed. Court orderss defendant remanded into custody. Sentencing hearing set for 4/6/16 at 3:00pm

Also witness list exchange deadline of 10/30/15.  Jury trial scheduled for January 27, 2016 at 08:30 am.
